idmSearchUserMetaRequest.title: Request for searching UserMeta by NodeUuid or by Namespace

JsonDefinition.title: Json-encoded type to provide accurate interface for edition

Order.title: Order is used for sorting lists of namesapces

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Context-resolved to quickly check if this meta is editable or not

idmUserMetaNamespace.title: Globally declared Namespace with associated policies

Cmd.title: Type of command to send (None, Pause, Resume, Stop, Delete, RunOnce, Inactive, Active)

jobsCtrlCommand.title: Command sent to control a job or a task

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

AwaitStatus.title: Optionally wait for the task to exist with a specific status

AwaitTimeout.title: Define a golang duration to wait for

restActionParameters.title: Parameters used by actions. Some may use Nodes/TargetNode, but not necessarily

restActionStatus.title: Used in an PerformActionResponse - currently always Background

Progress.title: Float value of the progress between 0 and 1

restBackgroundAction.title: Publishes a status about a background action

restContextWorkspace.description: Current workspace information, maybe published on the root node of a workspace
restContextWorkspace.title: ContextWorkspace

restCountMeta.title:
Open definition for a key/value metadata, value is a number
Using int32 to avoid json strings (for int64)

Source.title: Cells service name or other quickly useful info

restImageMeta.title: If file is an image, extracted information about this image

restIncomingNode.title: Lightweight node representation for creation, exposing a NodeLocator and additional data

restJsonMeta.title: Open definition for a key/value metadata, value stored in json

restLookupRequest.title:
Request for list/search. Accepts either
- a list of Locators (using path/* will list a folder's first level children) to retrieve stats about nodes
- a Query to search nodes in a more flexible way

restMetaToggle.title: Boolean value used for special metadata (bookmark,content_lock)

restNamespaceValuesOperation.title: Operations on namespaces that can persist values (typically, tags known values)

restNode.description: Representation of a file or folder

ContentLock.title: Flag set if a file is manually locked by a user

ContentType.title: ContentType in the form of application/mime

ContentsHash.title: ContentsHash is a server-computed file signature

ContextWorkspace.title: Additional information about the current workspace. Only published on the root node of a workspace/cell

DataSourceFeatures.title: Additional features set at the datasource level

FolderMeta.title: Open map of integers metadata published on folders

HashingMethod.title: HashingMethod refers to the method used for computing ContentsHash

ImageMeta.title: Additional metadata extracted by the server if file is an image

IsBookmarked.title: This node is bookmarked by the user

IsRecycleBin.title: If this node is a RecycleBin folder

IsRecycled.title: If this node is *inside* a RecycleBin folder

Metadata.title: Open map of metadata, values are JSON-encoded

Mode.title: Default is read/write, Mode can provide additional restrictions

Path.title: Node Path - Always starting with a workspace slug

Previews.title: List of available previews generated server-side

RevisionMeta.title: Additional metadata attached to a Version node

Shares.title: List of public links created on this file. Should be one but server supports multiple links

StorageETag.title: StorageEtag refers to the storage underlying hash

Type.title: Whether it's a folder ('COLLECTION') or a file ('LEAF')

restNode.title: Node

restNodeCollection.title: List of nodes, as returned by list/search operations. Facets and Pagination may be empty

restNodeLocator.title: Simple Uuid/Path discriminator to locate a node

restNodeUpdates.title: Set of updates to apply to metadata

Limit.title: Current Limit parameter, either passed by request or default value

NextOffset.title: Offset value for next page if there is one

PrevOffset.title: Offset value for previous page, if there is one

restPagination.title: Generic container for responses sending pagination information

CreatePassword.title: Set if switching from no password to password

UpdateCustomHash.title: Change the ShareLink Hash with a custom value

UpdatePassword.title: Set if updating an existing password

restPublicLinkRequest.title: Create or update a public link on a node

restSelection.description: Request to create a selection from a list of nodes.

AccessEnd.title: Timestamp after which the share is disabled

AccessStart.title: Timestamp of start date for enabling the share (not implemented yet)

LinkHash.title: Unique Hash for accessing the link

LinkUrl.title: Full URL for accessing the link

MaxDownloads.title: Maximum number of downloads until expiration

PasswordRequired.title: Whether a password is required or not to access the link

PoliciesContextEditable.title: Whether policies are currently editable or not

RootNodes.title: Nodes in the tree that serve as root to this link

TargetUsers.title: TargetUsers can be used to restrict access

UserLogin.title: Temporary user Login used to login automatically when accessing this link

UserUuid.title: Temporary user Uuid used to login automatically when accessing this link

ViewTemplateName.title: Display Template for loading the public link

restShareLink.title: Model for representing a public link

Editable.title: Whether this template can be edited or not

Node.title: Template node, can be a file or a tree of folders

restTemplate.title: A template can be used to create files or tree from scratch

Node.title: Whether it's a file or a folder

restTemplateNode.title: A template node is representing a file or a folder

restUserActionType.title: Authorized actions that user can trigger

restUserMeta.title: Userspace metadata (namespaces are defined by admin)

Location.title: Actual location of the stored version

Center.title: Either use a center point and a distance

Distance.description:
Example formats supported:
"5in" "5inch" "7yd" "7yards" "9ft" "9feet" "11km" "11kilometers"
"3nm" "3nauticalmiles" "13mm" "13millimeters" "15cm" "15centimeters"
"17mi" "17miles" "19m" "19meters"
If the unit cannot be determined, the entire string is parsed and the
unit of meters is assumed.

TopLeft.title: Or use a bounding box with TopLeft and BottomRight points

AppearsIn.title: Can be used for output when node is appearing in multiple workspaces

Etag.title: Hash of the content if node is a LEAF, Uuid or

Mode.description: Permission mode, like 0777. Stored as string using custom ModeString field.

Size.title: Size of the file, or cumulated size of folder

Content.title: Search in textual content (if search engine has this feature enabled)

DurationDate.title:
Compute MinDate/MaxDate with a Golang duration with a leading comparator (> or <)
Duration may contain "s" second, "m" minute, "d" day.
Example: ">10m" for files modified before 10minutes ago

ETag.title: Look for a specific ETag value, may only be useful to lookup for files with __temporary__ ETag

Extension.title:
Search files by their extension, use pipe symbol | if you wish to allow many extensions.
Example png|pdf|jpg

FileNameOrContent.title: Search in either filename or content (if search engine has this feature enabled)

FreeString.description:
Bleve-like search query to search for a specific metadata value.
When querying nodes, this will redirect this query to the Search Engine. When filtering an input, this will load an in-memory bleve engine to evaluate the node.

Bleve query string format is a space separated list of `[+-]key:value`, where node meta keys must be prepended with "Meta."
For Example, for tags: `+Meta.usermeta-tags:myvalue`

MaxDate.title: Range for modification date - node was modified before this date

MaxSize.title: Range for file size - size is smaller than

MinDate.title: Range for modification date - node was modified after this date

MinSize.title: Range for file size - size bigger than

PathDepth.title:
Restrict recursive listing to a given level of the tree starting from root.
Special value "-1" should list only one level in the folder defined by PathPrefix

PathPrefix.title: Recursive listing of nodes below a given path. Combine with the PathDepth parameter to limit request results

Paths.title: List of nodes paths, exactly matching

Type.title: Limit to a given node type (file or folder)

UUIDs.title: Preset list of specific node defined by their UUIDs

treeWorkspaceRelativePath.title:
Used in AppearsIn to signal a node is
appearing in multiple workspaces in the current context
